top_categories.workout_context: Greek Gravel rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Greek Gravel’s greek mountains, mountainous gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Greek Gravel isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Greek Gravel’s greek mountainous gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Greek Gravel when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Greek Gravel. Make this intensity feel like home.
Greek Gravel’s greek mountainous gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
The varied gradients at Greek Gravel reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Greek Gravel — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Every session at Greek Gravel intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Greek Gravel — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on greek mountainous gravel.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Greek Gravel — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Greek Gravel’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Greek Gravel. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Greek Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on greek mountainous gravel to build confidence. Expect: greek mountains, mountainous gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 65 miles of greek mountainous gravel in Peloponnese, Greece.
